SENT.plain: A six-year-old child with intracranial hypertension is described
Cranial computed tomography showed an expansive mass surrounded by a contrast enhancement ring in the right cerebellar hemisphere
Chest roentgenograms showed signs of pulmonary tuberculosis
Intracranial lesion was diagnosed as a tuberculoma and treated with tuberculostatic agents
Serial computed tomography scans showed a reduction of size of tuberculoma and appearance of a residual calcified image
